result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia without valid prescriptions. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain full-time employment and/or school
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Justin D Carter in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Margaret Drees, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety/Regular UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
